TopicTitle: Different shortcuts for different screen resolutions

Articles.Content:
I play KSP on a powerful laptop with a relatively low-res screen, but sometimes I plug into an external monitor with much better resolution. 

Is it possible to have different shortcuts that will start the game with different resolutions?

Edit: Problem description

The problem I am trying to avoid is that KSP goes to a black screen when I switch resolution in the Settings screen of the Main Menu and I cannot get out without force quitting.

I already start my game with a shortcut* that runs the game as a fullscreen popup window and forces opengl and hoped I could make it open with my desired resolution as well.

Edited August 29, 2018 by Nightside
Problem description

AFAIK, this is not possible in a stock game. Usually, suggesting mods in the 'unmodded support' section of the forum doesn't seem to be a good idea, but I'll do it anyway:

The mod does not provide a shortcut but a handy GUI to switch between different resolutions.
You could make two versions of the settings.ini and then write a script that renames/copies or makes symlinks to the version you want before launching the game.

@4x4cheesecake I'm not against a modded solution, but the problem I am trying to avoid is that KSP goes to a black screen when I switch resolution in the Settings screen of the Main Menu and I cannot get out without force quitting.

I already start my game with a shortcut* that runs the game as a fullscreen popup window and forces opengl and hoped I could make it open with my desired resolution as well.

* If this is considered "modding" by this subforum I can take my question elsewhere.

1 hour ago, Harry Rhodan said:

You could make two versions of the settings.ini and then write a script that renames/copies or makes symlinks to the version you want before launching the game.

I don't know how to do this, but I will investigate it a bit. It seems like other settings might change and not be current in both files.

I have a similar situation, I just have shortcuts to the KSP settings file and mechjeb settings file on my desktop that I hand edit before launch if I remember. In the KSP settings I change the resolution between 1920p and 4K and the gui scale from 0.8 to 1.4 depending on the screen resolution. Mechjeb settings get edited to change the gui scale. I wouldn't mind a script, but it just hasn't been enough of a nuisance yet.

Assuming you have enough space for 2 copies of the game and is willing to do so, I suggest making a copy, setting one for low res and one for higher res, and rename the shortcuts for identification perpuses.
